questions.question: Which of the following is the correct HTML element for inserting an image?

options: The title of the page as it appears in the browser’s title bar
The heading for the first section of the page
questions.answer: The title of the page as it appears in the browser’s title bar

options: Adds emphasis to the enclosed text (italicizes it)
Defines the title of the page
questions.answer: Adds emphasis to the enclosed text (italicizes it)

It contains the visible content of the webpage

questions.answer: It contains metadata for the webpage

It declares the beginning of an HTML document

questions.answer: It defines the document type and version of HTML

Opens the link in a new tab

What does the alt attribute in an tag do?
options: Specifies the title of the image.
Provides alternative text when the image is not available.
Aligns the image in the center.
questions.answer: Provides alternative text when the image is not available.

questions.question: Which of the following is correct about the <iframe> tag in HTML?
options: It is used to embed external applications like Google Maps.
It is used for embedding a multimedia object.
It is used to insert a background image.
questions.answer: It is used to embed external applications like Google Maps.

questions.question: What happens if you use a <title> tag inside the <body> tag?
options: The title is displayed on the web page.
It will display in the browser tab.
It will display an error message.

Which element is used to define navigation links in HTML?
What does the <meta> tag do in HTML?
options: It is used to define metadata like author, description, and keywords.
It is used for adding images.
questions.answer: It is used to define metadata like author, description, and keywords.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the <head> section in an HTML document?
options: It contains the body content of the page.
It holds metadata and links to stylesheets and scripts.
It defines the main structure of the page.
questions.answer: It holds metadata and links to stylesheets and scripts.

options: It defines the HTML version used in the document.
It specifies the content type of the document.
It helps to format the document content.
It links to the external CSS file.
questions.answer: It defines the HTML version used in the document.

What does the formaction attribute do in HTML?
options: It specifies the URL where the form data should be submitted.
It sets the default action for the form.
It specifies the method to send the form data.
It allows setting an action only for specific buttons.
questions.answer: It allows setting an action only for specific buttons.

questions.question: What tag would you use to create a dropdown menu in HTML?

What is the difference between the <strong> and <em> tags in HTML?
options: <strong> makes text bold, while <em> makes it italic.
<strong> adds emphasis to text, while <em> marks text as important.
<strong> represents a more semantic level of importance, while <em> only emphasizes text.
There is no difference; both are used for emphasis.
questions.answer: <strong> makes text bold, while <em> makes it italic.

questions.question: What does the target attribute in an anchor tag do in HTML?
options: Specifies where to display the linked document.
Specifies the title of the linked document.
Specifies the language of the linked document.
Specifies the URL of the linked document.
questions.answer: Specifies where to display the linked document.

questions.question: Which of the following tags is used for a footer in HTML5?
How do you define a line break in HTML?
What does the input type "range" do in HTML?
options: Defines a slider control for selecting a value within a range.
Defines a button to submit a form.
questions.answer: Defines a slider control for selecting a value within a range.

questions.question: What happens if an attribute is omitted in a <textarea> tag?
options: It will display a default value.
It will be treated as an empty field.
questions.answer: It will be treated as an empty field.

questions.question: Which tag defines a list item in HTML?
What happens when you include a <script> tag without a closing tag in HTML?
options: The browser will display an error message.
The script will run as expected.
The browser will ignore the script.
The browser will automatically close the script tag.
questions.answer: The browser will display an error message.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to define a hyperlink?
What does the method attribute of a <form> tag specify?
options: The type of HTTP request to send (GET or POST).
The name of the server-side script to process the form.
The type of form input (text, password, etc.).
The action to take after the form submission.
questions.answer: The type of HTTP request to send (GET or POST).

questions.question: What does the action attribute in a <form> element specify?
options: The location where the form data should be sent.
The style to apply to the form.
questions.answer: The location where the form data should be sent.

questions.question: How can you make a <div> element take up the full width of its container?
What does the alt attribute provide for an tag in HTML?
options: It specifies the height of the image.
It provides a description for users who cannot see the image.
It provides the link to the image.
It specifies the width of the image.
questions.answer: It provides a description for users who cannot see the image.

options: Opens the link in a new window or tab.
Opens the link in the same frame or window.
Displays the link in a popup.
questions.answer: Opens the link in the same frame or window.

questions.question: What is the <footer> tag used for in HTML5?
options: Contains information about the document, usually at the bottom.
questions.answer: Contains information about the document, usually at the bottom.

questions.question: What happens when you use the readonly attribute in an HTML form input?
options: The user cannot modify the input value.
The input cannot be submitted with the form.
The input is hidden from the form submission.
questions.answer: The user cannot modify the input value.

questions.question: What is the default display property of a <span> element in HTML?

What does the colspan attribute do in an HTML table?
options: Specifies the number of columns an element should span.
Specifies the number of rows an element should span.
Specifies the color of the cell.
Specifies the width of the table column.
questions.answer: Specifies the number of columns an element should span.
